Ditanya soal Polemik Cadar-Celana Cingkrang, Menag: Sudah Selesai itu
05 Nov 2019, 09:54 by Jefrie Nandy Satria
Jakarta - Wacana pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di instansi pemerintah yang dikemukakan Menteri Agama (Menag) Fachrul Razi masih menjadi polemik. Namun, menurut Fachrul Razi, hal itu telah selesai.
"Sudah selesai itu," kata Menag Fachrul Razi di Kementerian Agama (Kemenag), Jalan Lapangan Banteng Barat, Sawah Besar, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Dia mengatakan hal tersebut telah berulang-ulang ditanyakan kepadanya. Fachrul pun enggan berkomentar lebih lanjut.
"Udah, udah, udah bolak-balik itu," sambungnya.
Polemik mengenai pelarangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di instansi pemerintah ini memang telah menjadi buah bibir publik. Beberapa kalangan pun telah angkat bicara terkait polemik ini.
Wakil Ketua Komisi VIII DPR dari Fraksi Partai Golkar Ace Hasan Syadzily mengingatkan agar Fachrul berhati-hati merencanakan kebijakan. Menurut Ace, kajian larangan cadar dan celana cingkrang di instansi pemerintah justru menimbulkan pertanyaan serius. Pertanyaan lain, kata Ace, berkaitan dengan hubungan cadar dan celana cingkrang dengan radikalisme.
"Sebaiknya Menteri Agama lebih hati-hati dalam melontarkan rencana suatu kebijakan. Kita sama-sama harus melawan radikalisme karena itu bertentangan dengan nilai-nilai kebangsaan kita. Namun rencana kebijakan untuk menyelesaikan masalah radikalisme tidak boleh menimbulkan persepsi yang salah di mata masyarakat," kata Ace.

Asked about the Cingkrang Veil Polemic, Minister of Religion: It's Finished
05 Nov 2019, 09:54 by Jefrie Nandy Satria
Jakarta - The discourse on the prohibition of veils and trousers in government agencies stated by the Minister of Religion (Menag) Fachrul Razi is still a polemic. However, according to Fachrul Razi, this has been completed.
"It's finished," said Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi at the Ministry of Religion (Kemenag), Jalan Lapangan Banteng Barat, Sawah Besar, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
He said this had been repeatedly asked of him. Fachrul was reluctant to comment further.
"Already, already, already back and forth," he continued.
The polemic regarding the ban on veils and pants in government agencies has indeed become a byword of the public. Some circles have also spoken out about this polemic.
Deputy Chairman of Commission VIII of the DPR from the Golkar Party Faction Ace Hasan Syadzily reminded Fachrul to be careful in planning policies. According to Ace, the study of the ban on veils and trousers in government agencies raises serious questions. Another question, Ace said, is related to the relationship of the veil and the trousers with radicalism.
"The Minister of Religion should be more careful in launching a plan for a policy. We must both fight radicalism because it is against our national values. But the policy plan to resolve the problem of radicalism must not lead to wrong perceptions in the eyes of the community," said Ace.
